requirements.name: ARCH.1
requirements.description: All 3rd party libraries are identified and known to be needed.

requirements.name: ARCH.2
requirements.description: Security controls are enforced on remote endpoints.

requirements.name: ARCH.3
requirements.description: Cryptographically sign and verify automatic updates.

requirements.name: DATA.1
requirements.description: No sensitive data should be stored outside of the secure container.

requirements.name: DATA.2
requirements.description: No sensitive data is written to logs.

requirements.name: DATA.3
requirements.description: No sensitive data is shared with third parties unless it is a necessary part of the architecture.

requirements.name: DATA.4
requirements.description: The software does not hold sensitive data in memory longer than necessary and memory is cleared explicitly after use.

requirements.name: CRYP.1
requirements.description: The software does not rely on symmetric cryptography with hardcoded keys as a sole method of encryption.

requirements.name: CRYP.2
requirements.description: The software uses cryptographic primitives that are appropriate for the particular use-case.

requirements.name: CRYP.3
requirements.description: The software uses cryptographic primitives that are configured with parameters that adhere to industry best practices.

requirements.name: CRYP.4
requirements.description: Random values are generated using a sufficiently secure random number generator.

requirements.name: AUTH.1
requirements.description: If the software provides users access to a remote service some form of authentication such as username/password authentication is performed at the remote endpoint.

requirements.name: AUTH.2
requirements.description: If stateful session management is used the remote endpoint uses randomly generated session identifiers to authenticate client requests without sending the user's credentials.

requirements.name: AUTH.3
requirements.description: If stateless token-based authentication is used the server provides a token that has been signed using a secure algorithm.

requirements.name: AUTH.4
requirements.description: The remote endpoint terminates the existing session when the user logs out.

requirements.name: AUTH.5
requirements.description: A password policy exists and is enforced at the remote endpoint.

requirements.name: AUTH.6
requirements.description: The remote endpoint implements a mechanism to protect against the submission of credentials an excessive number of times.

requirements.name: AUTH.7
requirements.description: Sessions are invalidated by access token expiration.

requirements.name: AUTH.8
requirements.description: Sessions are invalidated at the remote endpoint after a predefined period of inactivity.

requirements.name: COMM.1
requirements.description: Data is encrypted on the network using TLS.

requirements.name: COMM.2
requirements.description: The secure channel is used consistently throughout the sofware.

requirements.name: COMM.3
requirements.description: The software verifies the X.509 certificate of the remote endpoint when the secure channel is established. Only certificates signed by a trusted CA are accepted.

requirements.name: QUAL.1
requirements.description: All inputs received from the endpoints are validated and if necessary sanitized.

requirements.name: QUAL.2
requirements.description: Object deserialization - if any - is implemented using safe serialization APIs.

requirements.name: QUAL.3
requirements.description: All third party components used by the software such as libraries and frameworks are identified and checked for known vulnerabilities.

requirements.name: QUAL.4
requirements.description: The software handles exceptions properly.

requirements.name: QUAL.5
requirements.description: In unmanaged code memory is allocated freed and used securely.

requirements.name: QUAL.6
requirements.description: An integrity check shall be performed and automatically monitored to detect image manipulations and reported to the CSC at start-up and runtime of virtual machine or container images

requirements.name: ENVI.1
requirements.description: The developer shall test proposed changes before deployment

requirements.name: ENVI.2
requirements.description: The developer shall harden host OS  components under its responsibility according to accepted industry standards and best practices

requirements.name: ENVI.3
requirements.description: The developer shall harden orchestrator components under its responsibility according to accepted industry standards and best practices

requirements.name: ENVI.4
requirements.description: The developer shall harden container configurations under its responsibility according to accepted industry standards and best practices

requirements.name: ENVI.5
requirements.description: The developer shall harden guest OS  components under its responsibility according to accepted industry standards and best practices

requirements.name: ENVI.6
requirements.description: Resilience level should be approved by human evaluator

requirements.name: ENVI.7
requirements.description: Network policies are defined to regulate inter-container communication based on minimal access.
